snippet: Temperatures topped 60 degrees this year during the Iditarod Trail Invitational, leaving trails bare and prompting speculation that climate change was responsible.
abstract: Unseasonably warm weather leaves trails bare in places during the Iditarod Trail Invitational, mixed ultra marathon long known for freezing temperatures and deep snow; shift allowed Jeff Oatley and several others, who race on bicycles, skis and on foot, to shatter 15-day record, and left many observers speculating about the impact of climate change.
lead_paragraph: Temperatures topped 60 degrees this year during the Iditarod Trail Invitational, leaving trails bare and prompting speculation that climate change was responsible.

headline.main: Photos: A Race Defined by Snow Finds Itself With Little
headline.print_headline: A Race Defined by Snow Finds Itself With Little
